definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The thief whisked into a red car when a policeman appeared at the corner.
sentences.chinese: 警察在街角一露頭，小偷立刻鑽進了一輛紅色小轎車。

sentences.english: Production was at 450 cars per day.
sentences.chinese: 工廠每天生產450輛小轎車。

sentences.english: The impact accordioned the car beneath the truck.
sentences.chinese: 砰地一撞，小轎車在卡車底下被壓扁了。

sentences.english: Carved on Tracy's gravestone is a car rolling down a mountain road.
sentences.chinese: 特蕾西的墓碑上刻有一輛沿着山路向下疾駛的小轎車。

sentences.english: Strength of a mother's love can be propelled to the extent to raise up a car supressed upon her own kid.
sentences.chinese: 母愛的力量可以大到舉起壓在愛子身上的小轎車。

sentences.english: A car will come to collect you from the hotel at 8.30 .
sentences.chinese: 一輛小轎車將在8點半把你從飯店接走。

sentences.english: After five years, this luxury sedan loses 84% of its purchase price.
sentences.chinese: 在五年之後，這種豪華小轎車損失它買入價的84%。

sentences.english: Take you ridding in my car car.
sentences.chinese: 我要載你坐上我的小轎車。

sentences.english: The driver of the fuel tanker swerved to avoid a car and crashed into a guardrail.
sentences.chinese: 該油車司機爲避開一輛小轎車，轉而撞向了防護欄。

sentences.english: Here she was sitting on the floor of a car so she wouldn't be seen by anyone.
sentences.chinese: 她就坐在一輛小轎車的底板上，不會被什麼人看到。

sentences.english: Twenty years ago, cars were owned only by organizations; private individuals couldn't buy them.
sentences.chinese: 二十年前，只有單位才擁有小轎車，私人是無權買的。

sentences.english: 1903 - Ford Motor Company shipped its first car.
sentences.chinese: 1903年的今天，福特汽車裝運其首輛小轎車。

sentences.english: Hidden dangers lurk in every family saloon car.
sentences.chinese: 每部家庭式雙排座小轎車都存在隱患。

sentences.english: Another blare of trumpets signaled that the limousine carrying Brezhnev had entered the Southwest Gate.
sentences.chinese: 在又一陣軍號聲中，勃列日涅夫的小轎車進入西南門。

sentences.english: The sound of the car died away in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 小轎車發出的噪音消逝在遠處。

sentences.english: I hate (having) to tell you, but I've damaged your car.
sentences.chinese: 我抱歉地告訴你，將你的小轎車搞壞了。

definition: to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
